Fixes crash of lua particle test while building lua-tests in release mode.
Fixes crash of lua particle test while building lua-tests in release mode.
Is that possible to make the ParticleSystem.update() in another thread.
data.body:
Cocos2d-x have got some performance issue when rendering particles. (5 particle emitter with 500 particle for each would consume 80% percent of CPU on iPhone 6S).

The caculations consumes most of the cycles, if we could do this in another thread, it would be much better.

Does anyone have done this? Have any suggestion?

Thanks in advance.

data.title: cocos2d::Director::getInstance()->pause(); is commented in applicationWillResignActive
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15.1
- devices test on: iPad Pro 9.7 iOS 10.3.2; iPad Air1 iOS 10.0; iPhone7 iOS 10.3.3
- developing environments
   - NDK version:
   - Xcode version: 8.3 (8E162)
   - VS version:
   - browser type and version:

Here are two methods from the AppController.mm

![screen shot 2017-09-04 at 16 00 39](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31069521/30025598-455d9374-918a-11e7-89d3-14e600e8edb8.png)

The fact that the method calls of `pause` and `resume` are commented results in issues in logic that is dependent on delta t, for example, `update` methods. This causes glitches and even crashes when the player swipes the notification center down then up.

After uncommenting the calls, the issues are gone.

This code has been commented for 4 years. Can you please tell me if it is safe to uncomment and release a version to our users.

@minggo, please look into this ASAP since it is blocking a major release.
Thank you.

data.title: Layout with PLIST can't stretch background image
data.body:
- cocos2d-x version: 3.15.1
- devices test on: macOS
- developing environments
   - NDK version: 16 (but also in 15)
   - Xcode version: -
   - VS version: -
   - CLion: 2017.2.2
   - browser type and version: -

Steps to Reproduce:

1. A call ala **layoutView->setBackGroundImage("Background.png");** will stretch the image to the content size of layoutView
2. If I pack the image with TexturePacker, and call **layoutView->setBackGroundImage("Background.png", ui::Layout::TextureResType::PLIST);** the same image won't be stretched.
